<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ADVERTISING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/22/google-ad-revenue-expected-fall-2020?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You Always Remember Your First Negative
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Google's sweating " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDUwL2dvb2dsZV9zX3N3ZWF0aW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Leading off today’s Tour de Big Tech is Google, which will <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/22/google-ad-revenue-will-drop-this-year-emarketer-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lose 5.3%</a> of its net U.S. advertising revenue this year, eMarketer said yesterday. It’s not just that this is the first ever decline in ad revenue for Google—minus the 2008 financial crisis, revenue’s grown by double digits every single year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>YouTube ad revenue is still expected to rise, but there aren’t enough Cuomo PowerPoint replays to make up for the 7.2% hit to Google Search revenue.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>Faced with plummeting demand, pandemic restrictions, and potential layoffs, many companies trimmed marketing budgets early in the crisis. Travel, one of the hardest hit sectors, is a particularly large client of Google’s ad business.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Expedia typically spends $5 billion on advertising. This year, execs don’t think their bill will hit $1 billion. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before you set up a GoFundMe...Google’s still <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-s-u-s-ad-revenue-is-expected-to-decline-in-2020-emarketer-says-11592830801?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expecting</a> almost $40 billion in ad revenue this year (it did $41.8 billion in 2019). And eMarketer says that could rebound more than 20% next year.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The bigger picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If eMarketer’s projections hold up, Google might cede some of its 32% market share to its biggest competitors, who escaped the sucker punch from the travel companies.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With 2019 ad revenues of $10.3 billion, Amazon’s in a distant third place, but it may finally be able to round up and claim 10% of the market. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In second is Facebook, where 2020 ad revenue is expected to grow 5% to $31.4 billion. It’s not the 26% growth rate of 2019, but with a pandemic in the mix, Zuck will take it. Especially when he’s dealing with a mini-advertiser revolt...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Civil rights groups called on advertisers to </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-facebook-ads-patagonia/patagonia-joins-the-north-face-in-facebook-ad-boycott-idUSKBN23T2JG?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pull July Facebook spend</a></span><span> in protest of the platform’s handling of political hate speech. North Face, Upwork, REI, and Patagonia said they’re in. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Since 2016, Google’s ad revenue hasn’t kept pace with growth in the larger digital ad market, leaving the door open for Facebook, Amazon, and others to step in.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IMMIGRATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/22/trump-sign-order-restricting-immigration-2020?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
That’s One Way to Limit Foreign Travel
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When one door closes, President Trump likes to lock up and keep it that way. Yesterday, the president signed an order <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/adolfoflores/trump-is-suspending-certain-visas-for-foreign-workers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suspending</a> some employment-based visas through the end of 2020, including: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>H-1B visas for high-skilled workers </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>H-2B visas for nonagricultural seasonal workers (like hospitality)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>L-1 visas for internal company transfers</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trump is also extending a <a href="https://www.axios.com/immigrant-suspension-coronavirus-trump-ban-89932a21-b4ac-48db-a758-8ecf50d43ed3.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">temporary ban</a> from April that restricts some foreigners from getting green cards. Senior officials told the WSJ the orders will <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-order-would-temporarily-suspend-new-h-1b-other-visas-11592853371?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">block 525,000 people</a> from entering the U.S. this year, including 170,000 green-card holders.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Trump’s reasoning: </strong>With unemployment at 13.3%, the administration wants to prioritize getting American workers back on payrolls. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Critics argue just because a job is open doesn’t mean a domestic worker can fill it. Tech companies and business groups have criticized efforts to curtail H-1Bs, which each year allow ~85,000 high-skilled foreign workers to bring their talents to the U.S. economy, especially in STEM fields.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Then there’s politics. Some critics are accusing the president of leveraging a public health crisis to push through his immigration agenda. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the administration is working on more permanent reforms that would affect H-1B visas and work permits for asylum seekers.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/22/canva-now-worth-6-billion-recent-round?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
If You Couldn't Design Before, Now You Canva
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="You can do it meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=420 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/yoJC2K6rCzwNY2EngA/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="You can do it meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/yoJC2K6rCzwNY2EngA/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Canva, the Sydney-based startup TechCrunch calls the “design platform for non-designers,” just closed a fundraising round at a <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/06/22/canva-raises-60-million-on-a-6-billion-valuation/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$6 billion valuation</a>, up from a $3.2 billion valuation in 2019.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Canva said yesterday that it raised $60 million led by Sequoia China and Blackbird, but turned down much more. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“We could’ve raised $2 billion, but I think that would have been a really stupid thing to do,” cofounder Cliff Obrecht told Forbes in a flawlessly executed humblebrag.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Sharing is caring</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like every other company except for Zoom, Canva wasn’t sure if COVID-19 would help or hurt its business. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Narrator: It helped. By focusing on its collaborative tools, design creations and sharing on Canva have risen over 50% since the pandemic began. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It also recently </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/06/16/canva-design-platform-partners-with-fedex-office-as-it-pushes-further-into-the-u-s/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">partnered with FedEx Office</a></span><span> to help power its push into the U.S.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With more than 30 million monthly users, 1.5 million of whom pay for Canva Pro, Canva is more concerned with being undervalued relative to other software companies. “It’s a valuation we’ve probably outgrown already,” said Obrecht, who decided to just ditch the humble.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Little-known fact: If advertisers fib, their noses grow like Pinocchio. Our team of copywriters is so incredibly vain that we could <em>never </em>deal with having poorly proportioned faces.</p>

When they do, <strong style="color:#000">the average return on those stocks is 931%</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, they independently gave the “all in buy” sign on <a href="https://www.fool.com/ext-content/all-in-stock-buy-alert-2/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210095&psource=esamnbwdg0210095&wsource=esamnbwdg0210095&testId=all-in-advert&cellId=3&campaign=sa-post-release" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one stock pick</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The kicker? David and Tom’s pick is <strong style="color:#000">only available</strong> to those intelligent souls who are members of Motley Fool <a href="https://www.fool.com/ext-content/all-in-stock-buy-alert-2/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210095&psource=esamnbwdg0210095&wsource=esamnbwdg0210095&testId=all-in-advert&cellId=3&campaign=sa-post-release" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Stock Advisor</a>. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/22/supreme-court-limits-secs-disgorgement-practices?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<img alt="Supreme Court" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84NTgvc3VwcmVtZV9jb3VydC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">People ask us how we decide which stories appear in this newsletter. Here’s one rule: If it contains the word “disgorgement,” you must write about it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Especially when it’s the subject of a big Supreme Court decision. Yesterday, the court <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-court-sec/u-s-supreme-court-sets-limits-on-secs-power-to-recover-ill-gotten-gains-idUSKBN23T239?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reined in</a> the Securities and Exchange Commission’s ability to seek “disgorgement,” a practice in which the agency collects money from fraudsters. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the 8–1 blowout decision, the Supreme Court said the SEC could still ask defendants to forfeit money…</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>...but the amount to be disgorged is now capped at the </span><span><em>profits</em></span><span> acquired through the fraud—nothing more.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The case in question:</strong> A California couple was ordered by the SEC to disgorge more than $26 million after they were found to have defrauded foreign investors over a cancer treatment center that was never built.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>The SEC says it collected $1.5 billion through disgorgements and penalties last fiscal year and paid out $1.2 billion to defrauded investors. It's probably <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-22/supreme-court-narrows-power-of-sec-to-recoup-illegal-gains?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">relieved</a> the court didn't eliminate the practice altogether.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ <strong style="color:#000">The big question...</strong>who’s going to make an “Ithaca Is Disgorges” t-shirt now?</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/22/microsoft-shuts-mixer?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Do Microsoft and a Confused Baker Have in Common?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Streamer Ninja" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDUxL3N0cmVhbWVyX25pbmphLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ethan Miller/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They’ve both lost their Mixers. In a kinda-shocking-but-not-altogether-unexpected move, Microsoft announced it was <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/22/21299032/microsoft-mixer-closing-facebook-gaming-partnership-xcloud-features?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shutting down</a> its streaming platform Mixer after failing to attract enough viewers to compete with rivals like Twitch and YouTube. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Zuck is sweeping up the crumbs:</strong></span><span> On July 22nd, all Mixer apps and sites will redirect to Facebook Gaming. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">If we’re talking streaming...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We have to mention Ninja. The face of <em>Fortnite</em> made tsunamis in the gaming community when he signed an exclusive deal with Mixer back in August of 2019. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Now, he’s a free agent after </span><span><a href="https://www.theloadout.com/mixer/facebook-gaming-ninja-shroud-contract-offer-turned-down?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">turning down</a></span><span> an offer from Facebook reportedly worth double the Mixer deal that earned him around $30 million. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But he's in an awkward situation because he burned some bridges with Amazon’s Twitch when he left.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> After Mixer’s demise, all thumbs at Microsoft HQ will get to work on xCloud, a “Netflix for video games” that Kareem Choudhry, head of Microsoft’s cloud gaming division, hopes will eventually reach <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2018/3/15/17123452/microsoft-gaming-cloud-xbox-future?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2 billion gamers</a>.</p>

Still, the housing market may be bouncing back—the big question is whether the rebound looks like a V or some less jagged letter.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCommodities: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePrices of raw materials are on a roll, the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/rally-in-raw-materials-signals-economic-rebound-11592818201?mod=hp_lista_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWSJ writes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. A pickup in industrial metals like tin and copper may indicate a faster-than-expected economic rebound.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nADVERTISING \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/22/google-ad-revenue-expected-fall-2020?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nYou Always Remember Your First Negative\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Google's sweating \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDUwL2dvb2dsZV9zX3N3ZWF0aW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLeading off today’s Tour de Big Tech is Google, which will \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/22/google-ad-revenue-will-drop-this-year-emarketer-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elose 5.3%\u003c/a\u003e of its net U.S. advertising revenue this year, eMarketer said yesterday. It’s not just that this is the first ever decline in ad revenue for Google—minus the 2008 financial crisis, revenue’s grown by double digits every single year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYouTube ad revenue is still expected to rise, but there aren’t enough Cuomo PowerPoint replays to make up for the 7.2% hit to Google Search revenue.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eFaced with plummeting demand, pandemic restrictions, and potential layoffs, many companies trimmed marketing budgets early in the crisis. Travel, one of the hardest hit sectors, is a particularly large client of Google’s ad business.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eExpedia typically spends $5 billion on advertising. This year, execs don’t think their bill will hit $1 billion. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBefore you set up a GoFundMe...Google’s still \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-s-u-s-ad-revenue-is-expected-to-decline-in-2020-emarketer-says-11592830801?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpecting\u003c/a\u003e almost $40 billion in ad revenue this year (it did $41.8 billion in 2019). And eMarketer says that could rebound more than 20% next year.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe bigger picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf eMarketer’s projections hold up, Google might cede some of its 32% market share to its biggest competitors, who escaped the sucker punch from the travel companies.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith 2019 ad revenues of $10.3 billion, Amazon’s in a distant third place, but it may finally be able to round up and claim 10% of the market. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn second is Facebook, where 2020 ad revenue is expected to grow 5% to $31.4 billion. It’s not the 26% growth rate of 2019, but with a pandemic in the mix, Zuck will take it. Especially when he’s dealing with a mini-advertiser revolt...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCivil rights groups called on advertisers to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-facebook-ads-patagonia/patagonia-joins-the-north-face-in-facebook-ad-boycott-idUSKBN23T2JG?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epull July Facebook spend\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in protest of the platform’s handling of political hate speech. North Face, Upwork, REI, and Patagonia said they’re in. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSince 2016, Google’s ad revenue hasn’t kept pace with growth in the larger digital ad market, leaving the door open for Facebook, Amazon, and others to step in.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen one door closes, President Trump likes to lock up and keep it that way. Yesterday, the president signed an order \u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/adolfoflores/trump-is-suspending-certain-visas-for-foreign-workers?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuspending\u003c/a\u003e some employment-based visas through the end of 2020, including: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eH-1B visas for high-skilled workers \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eH-2B visas for nonagricultural seasonal workers (like hospitality)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eL-1 visas for internal company transfers\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrump is also extending a \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/immigrant-suspension-coronavirus-trump-ban-89932a21-b4ac-48db-a758-8ecf50d43ed3.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etemporary ban\u003c/a\u003e from April that restricts some foreigners from getting green cards. Senior officials told the WSJ the orders will \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-order-would-temporarily-suspend-new-h-1b-other-visas-11592853371?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblock 525,000 people\u003c/a\u003e from entering the U.S. this year, including 170,000 green-card holders.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrump’s reasoning: \u003c/strong\u003eWith unemployment at 13.3%, the administration wants to prioritize getting American workers back on payrolls. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCritics argue just because a job is open doesn’t mean a domestic worker can fill it. Tech companies and business groups have criticized efforts to curtail H-1Bs, which each year allow ~85,000 high-skilled foreign workers to bring their talents to the U.S. economy, especially in STEM fields.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThen there’s politics. Some critics are accusing the president of leveraging a public health crisis to push through his immigration agenda. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe administration is working on more permanent reforms that would affect H-1B visas and work permits for asylum seekers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Yesterday, the court \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-court-sec/u-s-supreme-court-sets-limits-on-secs-power-to-recover-ill-gotten-gains-idUSKBN23T239?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereined in\u003c/a\u003e the Securities and Exchange Commission’s ability to seek “disgorgement,” a practice in which the agency collects money from fraudsters. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn the 8–1 blowout decision, the Supreme Court said the SEC could still ask defendants to forfeit money…\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e...but the amount to be disgorged is now capped at the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eprofits\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e acquired through the fraud—nothing more.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe case in question:\u003c/strong\u003e A California couple was ordered by the SEC to disgorge more than $26 million after they were found to have defrauded foreign investors over a cancer treatment center that was never built.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eThe SEC says it collected $1.5 billion through disgorgements and penalties last fiscal year and paid out $1.2 billion to defrauded investors. It's probably \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-22/supreme-court-narrows-power-of-sec-to-recoup-illegal-gains?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erelieved\u003c/a\u003e the court didn't eliminate the practice altogether.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e+ \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe big question...\u003c/strong\u003ewho’s going to make an “Ithaca Is Disgorges” t-shirt now?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: In a kinda-shocking-but-not-altogether-unexpected move, Microsoft announced it was \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/22/21299032/microsoft-mixer-closing-facebook-gaming-partnership-xcloud-features?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshutting down\u003c/a\u003e its streaming platform Mixer after failing to attract enough viewers to compete with rivals like Twitch and YouTube. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZuck is sweeping up the crumbs:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e On July 22nd, all Mixer apps and sites will redirect to Facebook Gaming. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIf we’re talking streaming...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe have to mention Ninja. The face of \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e made tsunamis in the gaming community when he signed an exclusive deal with Mixer back in August of 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNow, he’s a free agent after \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theloadout.com/mixer/facebook-gaming-ninja-shroud-contract-offer-turned-down?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eturning down\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e an offer from Facebook reportedly worth double the Mixer deal that earned him around $30 million. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut he's in an awkward situation because he burned some bridges with Amazon’s Twitch when he left.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom
